text:

Sutton United's Wayne Shaw appearing on Good Morning Britain with Piers Morgan Rex 
Sutton United's Wayne Shaw before he match Eddie Keogh/Reuters 7/11 
Wayne Shaw the Sutton reserve goalkeeper hovers the away dugout before the match between Sutton United and Arsenal David Price/Arsenal FC via Getty Images 8/11 
Sutton United's Wayne Shaw eats a pie during the match Andrew Couldridge/Action Images/Reuters 
Wayne Shaw during opening training session at Gander Green Lane Rex 
Wayne Shaw during opening training session at Gander Green Lane Rex 
Sutton United's manager Paul Doswell with reserve goalkeeper Wayne Shaw Andrew Couldridge/Action Images via Reuters 
Over 1,500 people have signed a petition to have Wayne Shaw reinstated after the 46-year-old acrimonious departure from Sutton United on Tuesday. 
The 46-year-old goalkeeper and coach resigned following a pie-eating stunt that marred the non-league side’s FA Cup encounter with Arsenal on Monday night . 
Shaw is the subject of investigations from the Gambling Commission and the Football Association after being filmed eating a pasty on the sidelines during his side’s 2-0 defeat to their Premier League side at Gander Green Lane. 
Shaw maintains he did not place a bet with Sun Bets, the bookmaker that also sponsored Sutton United’s shirts during the tie.
